snippet: The Bloomberg administration, settling a lawsuit, will voluntarily scale back on a controversial police tactic.
abstract: Bloomberg administration settles lawsuit brought against city by New York Civil Liberties Union over one aspect of its stop-and-frisk policies; Police Dept agrees to expunge from database hundreds of thousands of names collected during police stops that resulted in arrest or summons.
lead_paragraph: The Bloomberg administration, settling a lawsuit, will voluntarily scale back on a controversial police tactic.

headline.main: City Agrees to Expunge Names Collected in Stop-and-Frisk Program
headline.print_headline: Settling Lawsuit, City Agrees to Expunge Names Collected in the Stop-and-Frisk Program
